security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based regulatory consulting skill. No file system access, network operations, or code execution in the main skill content. Supporting files are benign placeholders.

content.user_title: Navigate FDA regulations for medical devices
content.value_statement: Medical device companies face complex FDA compliance requirements that delay market entry. This skill provides expert guidance on FDA pathways, QSR requirements, HIPAA compliance, and regulatory submission strategies.
actual_capabilities: Analyze FDA regulatory pathways including 510(k), PMA, and De Novo classifications
Guide Quality System Regulation (QSR) 21 CFR 820 compliance implementation
Provide HIPAA compliance framework for medical devices handling PHI
Support FDA submission preparation and management processes
Assist with FDA inspection readiness and warning letter response
limitations: Cannot provide legal advice or act as a licensed attorney
Cannot file submissions directly to the FDA on your behalf
Does not replace formal regulatory affairs professionals for critical submissions
Guidance is based on published FDA guidance documents and may require verification

use_cases.title: Plan regulatory pathway
use_cases.description: Determine FDA submission requirements and optimal pathway for novel medical devices

use_cases.title: Assess QSR compliance
use_cases.description: Evaluate quality system requirements and prepare for FDA inspections

use_cases.title: Implement HIPAA safeguards
use_cases.description: Develop compliance programs for devices handling protected health information

prompt_templates.title: Device classification
prompt_templates.prompt: My medical device [describe device] is being developed for [intended use]. Help me determine the FDA regulatory pathway and classification requirements.

prompt_templates.title: QSR compliance
prompt_templates.prompt: We need to implement 21 CFR 820 design controls for our medical device. Walk me through the requirements for design input, output, verification, and validation.

prompt_templates.title: HIPAA assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Our medical device collects patient data. What HIPAA technical and administrative safeguards do we need to implement?

prompt_templates.title: Submission strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare a comprehensive 510(k) submission checklist for our device, including required documentation, testing requirements, and timeline considerations.

output_examples.input: Our software as medical device (SaMD) needs FDA clearance for cardiac monitoring. What regulatory requirements apply?
output: Device Classification: Likely Class II requiring 510(k) clearance
Key FDA Guidance: FDA SaMD guidance, clinical evaluation guidance, cybersecurity guidance
Documentation Requirements: Intended use statement, predicate comparison, software documentation per FDA guidance
Testing Needs: Bench testing, cybersecurity assessment, possibly clinical validation
Timeline: 6-12 months typical for 510(k) with software changes requiring robust documentation

best_practices: Engage with FDA early through pre-submission meetings for novel devices
Maintain comprehensive design history files throughout development
Document all regulatory decisions and rationale for audit trails
anti_patterns: Assuming a predicate device is substantially equivalent without detailed comparison
Delaying compliance activities until late in development
Relying solely on this skill for critical regulatory decisions without professional oversight

faq.question: What FDA submission pathways are available?
faq.answer: Three main pathways: 510(k) for substantial equivalence to predicates, PMA for high-risk devices requiring clinical evidence, and De Novo for novel low-to-moderate risk devices.

faq.question: How long does FDA clearance take?
faq.answer: 510(k) averages 6 months but can take longer. PMA takes 12-18+ months. Timeline depends on device complexity, FDA workload, and response to questions.

faq.question: Can this skill file FDA submissions?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides guidance only. You must file submissions through the FDA eCopy system or use a regulatory affairs professional.

faq.question: Does this skill provide legal advice?
faq.answer: No. This skill offers regulatory information and guidance but does not constitute legal advice. Consult qualified regulatory counsel for specific situations.

faq.question: What is required for HIPAA compliance?
faq.answer: HIPAA requires administrative safeguards (policies, training), physical safeguards (facility access, device controls), and technical safeguards (encryption, access controls, audit logs).

faq.question: How does this compare to hiring a regulatory consultant?
faq.answer: This skill provides immediate regulatory guidance and information. Human consultants offer personalized strategy, represent you to FDA, and take legal responsibility for submissions.
